refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: SimpleSect is one of the top-level sectioning elements in a component. There are three types of sectioning elements in DocBook:

listitem.para: Explicitly numbered sections, Sect1â€¦Sect5, which must be properly nested and can only be five levels deep.
Recursive Sections, which are alternative to the numbered sections and have unbounded depth.
SimpleSects, which are terminal. SimpleSects can occur as the leaf sections in either recursive sections or any of the numbered sections, or directly in components.

refsection.para: None of the sectioning elements is allowed to float in a component. You can place paragraphs and other block elements before a section, but you cannot place anything after it.
The important semantic distinction of SimpleSect elements is that they never appear in the Table of Contents.

refsection.title: Processing expectations
refsection.para: SimpleSect elements never appear in the Table of Contents.
